algorithms.name: Document/post-prerendering activation steps list
algorithms.html: Every Document has a post-prerendering activation steps list, which is a list where each item is a series of algorithm steps. For convenience, we define the post-prerendering activation steps list for any platform object platformObject as:

steps.html: Return platformObject’s node document’s post-prerendering activation steps list.
Assert: platformObject’s relevant global object is a Window object.

algorithms.name: User-agent initiated prerendering
algorithms.html: To start user-agent initiated prerendering given a URL startingURL:

steps.html: Assert: startingURL’s scheme is an HTTP(S) scheme.
Let prerenderingTraversable be the result of creating a new top-level traversable given null and the empty string.
Set prerenderingTraversable’s loading mode to "prerender".

Let prefetchRecord be a new prefetch record whose URL is startingURL, anonymization policy is null, referrer policy is the empty string, No-Vary-Search hint is the default URL search variance, source is "browser UI", and prerendering traversable is prerenderingTraversable.
Start a referrer-initiated navigational prefetch given prerenderingTraversable’s active document and prefetchRecord.
Navigate prerenderingTraversable to startingURL using prerenderingTraversable’s active document.
When the user indicates they wish to commit a navigation to an activationURL which is a URL such that prefetchRecord matches a URL given activationURL:
If the user indicates they wish to create a new user-visible top-level traversable while doing so (e.g., by pressing Shift+Enter after typing in the address bar):
Update the successor for activation given prerenderingTraversable, startingURL, and activationURL.
Update the user agent’s user interface to present prerenderingTraversable, e.g., by creating a new tab/window.
Finalize activation for prerenderingTraversable given startingURL’s origin.
Alternately, if the user indicates they wish to commit the navigation into an existing top-level traversable predecessorTraversable (e.g., by pressing Enter after typing in the address bar):
Activate prerenderingTraversable in place of predecessorTraversable given "push", startingURL, and activationURL.

algorithms.name: start a referrer-initiated navigational prerender
algorithms.html: To start a referrer-initiated navigational prerender given a Document referrerDoc and a prefetch record prefetchRecord:

steps.html: Assert: prefetchRecord’s URL’s scheme is an HTTP(S) scheme.
If referrerDoc’s node navigable is not a top-level traversable, then return.
If referrerDoc’s browsing context is an auxiliary browsing context, then return.
If referrerDoc’s origin is not same site with prefetchRecord’s URL’s origin, then return.
If referrerDoc has a matching prefetch record given prefetchRecord with checkPrerender set to true, then return.
Assert: prefetchRecord’s prerendering traversable is "to be created".

Let prerenderingTraversable be the result of creating a new top-level traversable.

The user agent can use prefetchRecord’s prerendering target navigable name hint as a hint to their implementation of create a new top-level traversable. This hint indicates that the web developer expects the eventual activation of the created prerendering traversable to be in place of a particular predecessor traversable: the one that would be chosen by the invoking the rules for choosing a navigable given prefetchRecord’s prerendering target navigable name hint and referrerDoc’s node navigable.
Set prerenderingTraversable’s loading mode to "prerender".
Set prefetchRecord’s prerendering traversable to prerenderingTraversable.
Set prerenderingTraversable’s remove from referrer to be an algorithm which sets prefetchRecord’s prerendering traversable to null.
Start a referrer-initiated navigational prefetch given referrerDoc and prefetchRecord.
Navigate prerenderingTraversable to prefetchRecord’s URL using referrerDoc, with referrerPolicy set to prefetchRecord’s referrer policy.

algorithms.name: prerendering traversable/update the successor for activation
algorithms.html: To update the successor for activation given a prerendering traversable successorTraversable, a URL startingURL, and a URL activationURL:

steps.html: Let successorDocument be successorTraversable’s active document.
If startingURL equals successorDocument’s URL and startingURL does not equal activationURL:
Assert: successorDocument can have its URL rewritten to activationURL.
Let navigation be successorDocument’s relevant global object’s navigation API.
Let continue be the result of firing a push/replace/reload navigate event at navigation given "replace", activationURL, and true.
If continue is true, run the URL and history update steps given successorDocument and activationURL.

algorithms.name: prerendering traversable/activate
algorithms.html: To activate a prerendering traversable successorTraversable in place of a top-level traversable predecessorTraversable given a history handling behavior historyHandling, a URL startingURL, a URL activationURL, an optional navigation ID navigationId:

steps.html: Assert: successorTraversable’s active document’s is initial about:blank is false.
If navigationId is not given, then let navigationId be the result of generating a random UUID.
Let referrerOrigin be predecessorTraversable’s active document’s origin.
Set predecessorTraversable’s ongoing navigation to navigationId.
In parallel, run these steps:
Let unloadPromptCanceled be the result of checking if unloading is user-canceled for predecessorTraversable’s active document’s inclusive descendant navigables.
If unloadPromptCanceled is true, or predecessorTraversable’s ongoing navigation is no longer navigationId, then abort these steps.
Queue a global task on the navigation and traversal task source given predecessorTraversable’s active window to abort predecessorTraversable’s active document.
Update the successor for activation given successorTraversable, startingURL, and activationURL.
Append session history traversal steps to predecessorTraversable to perform the following steps:
Assert: successorTraversable’s current session history step is 0.
Assert: successorTraversable’s session history entries’s size is 1.
Let successorEntry be successorTraversable’s session history entries[0].
Remove successorEntry from successorTraversable’s session history entries.
Finalize a cross-document navigation given predecessorTraversable, historyHandling, and successorEntry.
Update the user agent’s user interface to reflect this change, e.g., by updating the tab/window contents and the browser chrome.
Finalize activation for successorTraversable given referrerOrigin.

Perhaps we should do something with WebDriver BiDi here? See w3c/webdriver-bidi#321. Right now the pre-in parallel part of the navigate algorithm will send WebDriver BiDi navigation started as if it were a normal navigation, but then nothing will happen to indicate the navigation finishes.

algorithms.name: prerendering traversable/finalize activation
algorithms.html: To finalize activation of a top-level traversable traversable given an origin origin:

steps.html: For each navigable of traversable’s active document’s inclusive descendant navigables, queue a global task on the navigation and traversal task source, given navigable’s active window, to perform the following steps:
For each origin → hintSet in navigable’s prerender-scoped Accept-CH cache:
Set Accept-CH cache[origin] to hintSet.
Let doc be navigable’s active document.

We should really propagate the loading mode change here, in the posted task. This is where implementations would update what is returned by document.prerendering. However, right now it lives on the traversable, so it gets magically updated when we move over the session history entry. Probably we need to move it to the Document.
If doc’s origin is the same as origin, then set doc’s activation start time to the current high resolution time for doc’s relevant global object.
Fire an event named prerenderingchange at doc.
For each steps in doc’s post-prerendering activation steps list:
Run steps.
Assert: running steps did not throw an exception.

algorithms.name: prerendering traversable/remove from referrer
algorithms.html:
A prerendering traversable has an associated remove from referrer, which is null or an algorithm with no arguments, initially set to null.

To ensure that the references for a prerendering traversable are cleared once it is destroyed, modify destroy a top-level traversable by appending the following step:

steps.html: If traversable is a prerendering traversable and traversable’s remove from referrer is not null, then call traversable’s remove from referrer.

algorithms.name: create a new child navigable patch
algorithms.html: To ensure that any child navigables inherit their parent’s loading mode, modify create a new child navigable by appending the following step:

steps.html: Set navigable’s loading mode to element’s node navigable’s loading mode.

algorithms.name: find a matching prerendered prefetch record
algorithms.html: To find a matching prerendered prefetch record given a Document predecessorDocument and URL url:

steps.html: Let recordToUse be null.
For each record of predecessorDocument’s prefetch records:
If record’s prerendering traversable is not a prerendering traversable, then continue.
If record’s prerendering traversable’s active document’s is initial about:blank is true, then continue.
If record’s URL is equal to url:
Set recordToUse to record.
Break.
If recordToUse is null and record matches a URL given url:
Set recordToUse to record.
If <var>recordToUse</var> is not null:
Remove recordToUse from predecessorDocument’s prefetch records.
Return recordToUse.

algorithms.name: wait for a matching prerendered prefetch record
algorithms.html: To wait for a matching prerendered prefetch record given a navigable navigable, a URL url, a string cspNavigationType, and a POST resource, string, or null documentResource:

steps.html: Assert: this is running in parallel.

If any of the following conditions hold:

  • navigable is not a top-level traversable;

  • navigable is a prerendering traversable;

  • navigable is a fenced frame;

  • cspNavigationType is not "other"; or

  • documentResource is not null

then return null.
Let predecessorDocument be navigable’s active document.
Let cutoffTime be null.
While true:
Let completeRecord be the result of finding a matching prerendered prefetch record given predecessorDocument and url.
If completeRecord is not null, return completeRecord.
Let potentialRecords be an empty list.
For each record of predecessorDocument’s prefetch records:

If all of the following are true, then append record to potentialRecords:

  • record’s prerendering traversable is a prerendering traversable;

  • record’s prerendering traversable’s active document’s is initial about:blank is true;

  • record is expected to match a URL given url; and

  • cutoffTime is null or record’s start time is less than cutoffTime.
If potentialRecords is empty, return null.
Wait until the ongoing navigation of the prerendering traversable of any element of predecessorDocument’s prefetch records changes.

If cutoffTime is null and any element of potentialRecords has a prerendering traversable whose active document’s is initial about:blank is false, set cutoffTime to the current high resolution time for the relevant global object of predecessorDocument.

algorithms.name: navigate activate patch
algorithms.html: In navigate, insert the following steps as the first ones after we go in parallel:

steps.html: Let record be the result of waiting for a matching prerendered prefetch record given navigable, url, cspNavigationType, and documentResource.
If <var>record</var> is not null, then:
Let matchingPrerenderedNavigable be record’s prerendering traversable.
Let startingURL be record’s URL.
Activate matchingPrerenderedNavigable in place of navigable given historyHandling, startingURL, url, and navigationId.
Abort these steps.

algorithms.name: create navigation params by fetching patch
algorithms.html: In create navigation params by fetching, add the following step near the top of the algorithm:

steps.html: Let initiatorOrigin be entry’s document state’s initiator origin.

algorithms.name: create navigation params by fetching patch
algorithms.html: Append the following steps after the first sub-step under "While true:":

steps.html: If navigable is a prerendering navigable and currentURL’s origin is not same site with initiatorOrigin, then:
If navigable is a top-level traversable, then return null.

Otherwise, the user agent must wait to continue this algorithm until navigable’s loading mode becomes "normal". At any point during this wait (including immediately), it may instead choose to destroy navigable’s top-level traversable and return null from this algorithm.

algorithms.name: create navigation params by fetching patch
algorithms.html: Append the following steps toward the end of the algorithm, after the steps which check <var>locationURL</var>:

steps.html: If navigable is a prerendering navigable, and responseOrigin is not same origin with initiatorOrigin, then:
Let loadingModes be the result of getting the supported loading modes for response.
If loadingModes does not contain `credentialed-prerender`, then return null.

algorithms.name: attempt to populate the history entry's document patch
algorithms.html: In attempt to populate the history entry’s document, append the following after the steps which establish the value of failure, but before the other steps which act on it:

steps.html: then:
Destroy navigable’s top-level traversable.
Return.
If navigable is a prerendering traversable and navigable’s prerender initial response search variance is null:
Set navigable’s prerender initial response search variance to the result of obtaining a URL search variance given navigationParams’s response.

algorithms.name: hand-off to external software patch
algorithms.html: In hand-off to external software, prepend the following step:

steps.html: If navigable is a prerendering navigable, then return without invoking the external software package.

algorithms.name: navigate historyHandling patch
algorithms.html: Patch the navigate algorithm to ensure the session history of a prerendering navigable stays trivial by prepending the following step before all others:

steps.html: If navigable is a prerendering navigable, then set historyHandling to "replace".

algorithms.name: URL and history update steps patch
algorithms.html: Patch the URL and history update steps by adding the following step after step 1:

steps.html: If navigable is a prerendering navigable, then set historyHandling to "replace".
Empty document’s post-prerendering activation steps list.

algorithms.name: PerformanceNavigationTiming/activationStart
algorithms.html: The activationStart getter steps are:

steps.html: Return this’s relevant global object’s associated Document’s activation start time.

algorithms.name: update the client hints set from cache patch
algorithms.html: Modify the update the client hints set from cache algorithm, by replacing the second step with the following steps.

steps.html: Let navigable be settingsObject’s global object’s navigable.
Let originMatchingEntries be the entries in the Accept-CH cache whose origin is same origin with settingsObject’s origin.
If navigable is a prerendering navigable, then:
Let prerenderAcceptClientHintsCache be navigable’s prerender-scoped Accept-CH cache.
Let origin be settingsObject’s origin.
If prerenderAcceptClientHintsCache[origin] exists, then let originMatchingEntries be the entries in the prerenderAcceptClientHintsCache whose origin is same origin with origin.

algorithms.name: create or override the cached client hints set patch
algorithms.html: Modify the create or override the cached client hints set algorithm, by updating the last step.

steps.html: Let navigable be settingsObject’s global object’s navigable.
If navigable is a prerendering navigable, set navigable’s prerender-scoped Accept-CH cache[origin] to hintSet.
Otherwise, set Accept-CH cache[origin] to hintSet.

algorithms.name: clear prerender cache
algorithms.html: To clear prerender cache given an origin origin:

steps.html: For each top-level traversable traversable of the user agent’s top-level traversable set:
Let navigables be the inclusive descendant navigables of traversable’s active document.
For each navigable in navigables:
Let activeDocument be the navigable’s active document.
If activeDocument’s origin is not same origin with origin, then continue.
For each prefetchRecord in activeDocument’s prefetch records:
If prefetchRecord’s prerendering traversable is null, then continue.
Cancel and discard prefetchRecord given activeDocument.

algorithms.name: HTTP-network-or-cache fetch patch
algorithms.html: Modify HTTP-network-or-cache fetch by adding the following step after the existing step that sets `Sec-Purpose`:

steps.html: Otherwise, if httpRequest’s client is an environment settings object whose global object is a Window, and that Window’s navigable is a prerendering navigable:
Let purpose be a List containing the Token prefetch.
Add a parameter whose key is "prerender" and whose value is true to the prefetch token in purpose.
Set a structured field value given (`Sec-Purpose`, purpose) in httpRequest’s header list.

algorithms.name: get the supported loading modes
algorithms.html: To get the supported loading modes for a response response:

steps.html: If response is a network error, then return an empty list.
Let slmHeader be the result of getting a structured field value given `Supports-Loading-Mode` and "list" from response’s header list.
Return a list containing all elements of slmHeader that are tokens.
If subject’s node navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append the following step to subject’s post-prerendering activation steps list and return.

algorithms.name: cannot show simple dialogs patch
algorithms.html: Modify the cannot show simple dialogs algorithm, given a Window window, by prepending the following step:

steps.html: If window’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then return true.

algorithms.name: window print() patch
algorithms.html: Modify the print() method steps by prepending the following step:

steps.html: If this’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then return.

algorithms.name: DelayWhilePrerendering method steps
algorithms.html: The method steps for any operation annotated with the [DelayWhilePrerendering] extended attribute are replaced with the following:

steps.html: Let realm be the current realm.
If the operation in question is a regular operation, then set realm to the relevant realm of this.
If realm’s global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then:
Let promise be a new promise, created in realm.
Append the following steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list:
Let result be the result of running the originally-specified steps for this operation, with the same this and arguments.
Resolve promise with result.
If this operation’s return type is a promise type, then return promise.
Otherwise, return the result of running the originally-specified steps for this operation, with the same this and arguments.

algorithms.name: Geolocation getCurrentPosition patch
algorithms.html: Modify the getCurrentPosition() method steps by prepending the following step:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append the following steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list and return.

algorithms.name: Geolocation watchPosition patch
algorithms.html: Modify the watchPosition() method steps by prepending the following step:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then:
Let watchId be an implementation-defined unsigned long, and note it as a post-prerendering activation geolocation watch process ID.
Append the following steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list, with the modification that the watchId generated must use watchId as its ID, and return watchId.

algorithms.name: Geolocation clearWatch patch
algorithms.html: Modify the clearWatch(watchId) method steps by prepending the following step:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then:
If watchId is a post-prerendering activation geolocation watch process ID, then remove its corresponding steps from this’s post-prerendering activation steps list.
Return.

algorithms.name: Serial getPorts patch
algorithms.html: Modify the getPorts() method steps by inserting the following steps after the initial creation of promise:

steps.html: Let document be this’s relevant global object’s associated Document, if this’s relevant global object is a Window, or this’s relevant global object’s owner document, if this’s relevant global object is a DedicatedWorkerGlobalScope.
If document is null, then return a promise rejected with a "SecurityError" DOMException.
If document’s node navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append the following steps to document’s post-prerendering activation steps list and return promise.

algorithms.name: Notification constructor patch
algorithms.html: Modify the Notification() constructor steps by replacing the step which goes in parallel with the following:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append these steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list. Otherwise, run these steps in parallel.

algorithms.name: Notification permission patch
algorithms.html: Modify the permission static getter steps by replacing them with the following:

steps.html: If the current global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then return "default".
Otherwise, get the notifications permission state and return it.

algorithms.name: Sensor start patch
algorithms.html: Modify the start() method steps by inserting the following steps after the state is set to "activating":

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append the following steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list and return.
If this.[[state]] is "idle", then return.
Assert: this.[[state]] is "activating".

algorithms.name: Navigator getBattery patch
algorithms.html: Modify the getBattery() method steps by prepending the following step:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append the following steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list and return this.[[BatteryPromise]].

algorithms.name: apply orientation lock patch
algorithms.html: Modify the apply orientation lock algorithm steps by overwriting the first few steps, before it goes in parallel, as follows:

steps.html: Let promise be a new promise.
If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append the following steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list and return promise.
If the user agent does not support locking the screen orientation, then reject promise with a "NotSupportedError" DOMException and return promise.

If the document’s active sandboxing flag set has the sandboxed orientation lock browsing context flag set, or the user agent doesn’t meet the pre-lock conditions to perform an orientation change, then reject promise with a "SecurityError" DOMException and return promise.
Set the document’s [[orientationPendingPromise]] to promise.

algorithms.name: getGamepads patch
algorithms.html: Modify the getGamepads() method steps by prepending the following step:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then return an empty sequence.

algorithms.name: gamepadconnected post-prerendering
algorithms.html: Modify the gamepadconnected section to indicate that every Document document’s post-prerendering activation steps list should gain the following steps:

steps.html: If document is allowed to use the "gamepad" feature, and document’s relevant settings object is a secure context, and any gamepads are connected, then for each connected gamepad, fire an event named gamepadconnected at document’s relevant global object using GamepadEvent, with its gamepad attribute initialized to a new Gamepad object representing the connected gamepad.

algorithms.name: mediacapture device-change path
algorithms.html: Modify the MediaDevices section by prepending the following step to the device change notification steps:

steps.html: If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then return.

algorithms.html: Also modify AudioContext() constructor steps to have the following step before returning the constructed object.

steps.html: Else if context is not allow to start only due to the prerendering, then append the following steps to context’s post-prerendering activation steps list.
Set the [[control thread state]] on context to running.
Queue a control message to resume context.

algorithms.name: dom-navigator-registerProtocolHandler patch
algorithms.html: Modify the registerProtocolHandler(scheme, url) method steps by overwriting the first few steps, before it goes in parallel, as follows:

steps.html: Let (normalizedScheme, normalizedURLString) be the result of running normalize protocol handler parameters with scheme, url, and this’s relevant settings object.
If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append the following steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list and return.

algorithms.name: dom-navigator-unregisterprotocolhandler patch
algorithms.html: Modify the unregisterProtocolHandler(scheme, url) method steps by overwriting the first few steps, before it goes in parallel, as follows:

steps.html: Let (normalizedScheme, normalizedURLString) be the result of running normalize protocol handler parameters with scheme, url, and this’s relevant settings object.
If this’s relevant global object’s navigable is a prerendering navigable, then append the following steps to this’s post-prerendering activation steps list and return.
